Steam Next Fest 2024 has formally ended, we've spent a couple of weeks gorging upon demos of all stripes, from oil spill clean-up to dancefloor kendo, and now comes the all-important process of deciding which of those demos Won. Valve have helpfully shared a list of the most played Steam demos during this latest, gravest round of next festivity, and it covers a reasonable range. I mean, I wasn't that surprised to see an open world survival shooter with monsters at the top of the ladder - why else would we dedicate a bunch of Best Of features to such things? - but I am surprised that number three is a leering parody of neglect. Also, there's a game about mopping dungeons that appeals strongly to my Dungeon Meshi-watching sensibilities.
 
Read more
articles.title: Steam Next Fext 2024's most popular demos include goblin maid sims, horror shooters and a Chinese game about an unmarried no-lifer

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
The Remake Of The End Of The Greatest RPG Of All Time, or TROTEOTGRPGOAT for, uh, short, is a game that exists. I normally wouldn’t let such an opaque stub of a description survive outside of a quick Trello reminder to write something better later, but I’m currently finding it fulfilling enough just to gaze upon that title and consider the fully formed art object that may soon emerge from its tantalising promises. Ok, so the visual component helps too. Orientate yourself by means of the trailer below, and let’s dig into this brazen nose-hooker of a head turner of a game that does exist, about another game that doesn’t.
Read more
articles.title: The Remake Of The End Of The Greatest RPG Of All Time is a puzzle game hidden inside a fictional RPG

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
You forgot about Habbo Hotel, didn't you? Habbo Hotel. With those words and the above image, it is possible I have sent a shocking dose of neurochemical nostalgia through your brain and into your various internal organs. Your vision blurs. You sweat. You are 12 years old again, frightened and intrigued at the idea of graduating to teenhood, bathing in the cool glow of a cream-coloured CRT computer monitor. "Habbo Hotel is back!" is what I might shout if I did not know better, snapping you back to the present day in an act of psychological whiplash. The truth is the pixellated hangout zone of the early 2000s never went away. It has been alive this whole time. You forgot about the Hotel. But the Hotel did not forget about you.
Today, developers Sulake are doing something to jog your memory. They are calling it Habbo Hotel: Origins. I ask you to think carefully before you go there.
Read more
articles.title: The Habbos return in Habbo Hotel: Origins, a relaunch of the 2000s chatroom game

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Edwin backstory fragment #345: the greatest usage to which I have ever put my failing grasp of mathematics is determining how many different RPGs I could buy using the "same" money, by dint of trading them in promptly at Gamestation for carefully calculated diminishing returns. I'd save up to buy one of the premium headliners, attempt to get my money's worth inside a week, then swap it for a respected double-A and perhaps a sub-£8 oddity with the manual missing - nesting one purchase within the other like a series of Matryoshka dolls.
This was my Big Short, my Moneyball. But it had a drawback: often, I was so eager to leapfrog to another game before the trade-in price changed that I skimmed RPGs that are now considered classics. The big one was Suikoden 2, which I spent only an evening with before gambling that I'd eke more FunValue out of a game with a less traditional battle system. I can't remember what I traded that for, which says it all. Another was Baten Kaitos on Gamecube, which - yes, we are finally getting to the point here - has just been rereleased on Steam in the shape of a Baten Kaitos I & II HD Remaster. I can't remember what I traded Baten Kaitos for either, which again, says it all. Please, gentle reader - be better.
 
Read more
articles.title: Bandai Namco's rather glorious-looking Baten Kaitos RPG remasters are now on Steam

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Life By You, the Sims-like management game previously troubled by several delays, has been canceled by Paradox Interactive, and Californian studio Paradox Tectonic have been shut down. The news of the game’s cancellation came last night through a forum post, with Paradox deputy CEO Mattias Lilja painting a picture of a game still too “lacking” for more development time to fix. This morning, it emerged that Paradox Tectonic, the studio working on the game, have been shuttered, via GameWatcher.
 
Read more
articles.title: Paradox shutter studio Tectonic and cancel troubled Sims competitor Life By You

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Starfield’s first expansion, this year’s Shattered Space, won’t be the only major DLC for the sci-fi exploration game, Bethesda bossman Todd Howard has confirmed.
Read more
articles.title: Starfield will get at least one more expansion after Shattered Space, Todd Howard says

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
A Quiet Place is a very solid horror movie that seemed primed for a video game adaptation from the off. After all, it already had all the ingredients of a video game right there: the whole film is essentially one overlong stealth mission with a punishing fail state - any crunchy glass or other noise would immediately draw the attention of deadly alien monsters - and at one point there’s a whiteboard with the narrative equivalent of Dead Space’s “CUT OFF THEIR LIMBS” graffiti scrawled on it. Lo and behold, we’re getting a Quiet Place video game.
Read more
articles.title: A Quiet Place video game resurfaces with a new name, first look at gameplay and 2024 release date

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Baldur's Gate 3’s upcoming mod support update, which will introduce official modding tools to the sprawling Dungeons & Dragons RPG later this year, will effectively serve as Larian’s swan song for their work on the game.
Read more
articles.title: Baldur’s Gate 3 mod update will be Larian’s ‘final handover’ to players

articles.author: Matt Jarvis
articles.description:
Remember Lords of the Fallen? No, not that one. This one. Last year’s reboot of the 2014 game of exactly the same name - despite the successor originally being a numbered sequel, then at least having a ‘The’ at the start of its title to help tell them apart a little - will now get its own follow-up in a third Lords of the Fallen game. The upcoming sequel doesn’t have a name yet, but I really hope they stick with the bit and just call it “Lords of the Fallen” again.
Read more
articles.title: Lords of the Fallen reboot Lords of the Fallen is getting a sequel in 2026, probably called Lords of the Fallen

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
Fumes has starred in a few Screenshot Saturday round-ups but this is the first time, to my knowledge, that somebody from the Treehouse has slipped behind the wheel and taken this crusty old banger for a spin. I am glad to have done so. Created by a team of four, Fumes is the Mad Max X Vigilante 8 adaptation somebody really should have made in the 90s, when the very thought of such a thing would have had me flipping tables and then sheepishly righting them again, before being sent to bed with no dinner.
It's an open world combat racer with boisterous arcade handling, pop-out guns that wiggle about like hood ornaments, some kaiju-wannabe boss vehicles, a delightfully crunchy, sooty artstyle and a passably earwormy metal soundtrack. I'm not entirely convinced it has longevity beyond its impeccably scorched and dented PS1 vibes, but I definitely think you should try the demo, now that the early access version is out.
 Read more
articles.title: Fumes is a Mad Max-tinted open world Twisted Metal full of absolutely furious rally cars

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
The perpetually scarlet-faced and jovially maladroit folk of Embracer have done their usual vaudeville comedy routine of spinning around with negative-dollar signs in their eyes and trampling on another game development studio - in this case, Pieces Interactive, creators of the recent Alone In The Dark reboot. The Swedish studio's website is now a tombstone, bearing the dates 2007-2024. Oopsy-daisy!

 
Read more
articles.title: Embracer shut down Alone In The Dark rebooters Pieces Interactive, creators of Magicka and Titan Quest DLCs

articles.author: Brendan Caldwell
articles.description:
Scottish petrochemical horror is not exactly a genre, but maybe it ought to be. From the opening moments of Still Wakes The Deep you know life on its 1970s North Sea oil rig is precarious. Leaky ceilings, busted panelling, faulty drill machinery - the omens pile up as you spend your first thirty minutes wandering through the colleague-packed canteen and over the platform into the boss' office for a severe dressing-down. It's a classic pre-disaster setup for a mostly traditional monster story, yet the game sticks expertly to the first-person horror form, and its voice actors' performances are so spot-on, that it'd feel churlish to judge this foaming fear simulator for sticking to type. It also has some markedly unsettling use of the shipping forecast, a famously dull feature of British radio I definitely did not expect to freak me out in a video game.
Read more
articles.title: Still Wakes The Deep review: soaked in sea horror and shiveringly good voice acting

articles.author: Nic Reuben
articles.description:
Well, shovel me timbers! Shovel Knight, the retro platformer that started it all (it all being everything from a roguelike spin-off to a Dead Cells cameo) turns 10 this month, and Yacht Club Games are releasing a ultimate edition to celebrate. Entitled the ‘Shovel Of Hope DX’, this definitive-me-doo bundles in the original game with old and new features like saving and rewinding, over 20 playable characters, local and online co-op, and new modes. Grab your shovel and prepare to dig for the trailer, then look foolish as you realise it’s directly below this paragraph.
 
Read more
articles.title: Shovel Knight is getting online co-op as part of a new Shovel Of Hope DX edition for its 10th anniversary

articles.author: Edwin Evans-Thirlwell
articles.description:
"Two's company, three's a crowd," the saying goes, unless the first two are warriors and the third one is a priest, in which case the superior proverb is surely "three's a moderately balanced squad, two's a massive liability"? Here to put such kitchen wisdom to the test is BioWare's Dragon Age: The Veilguard, which "only" allows you to bring two companions into the fray, one fewer than 2014's Dragon Age: Inquisition. It's another indication that this will be more biffy action game than thinky party-based RPG. The upside, assuming you find that last sentence disappointing, is that exploration and combat will be more "intimate", and individual characters will have more screentime to bounce off each other and flourish as personalities. All this comes care of a BioWare Discord Q&A from late last week, which you can watch in full below.
 Read more
articles.title: Dragon Age: The Veilguard strips your RPG party down to two companions, but they'll be "deeper" with a lot more banter

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: V dnešním článku budeme pokračovat v popisu technologie strukturálního pattern matchingu, jenž je nedílnou součástí programovacího jazyka Coconut. Některé vzorky, které si ukážeme, přesahují možnosti Pythonu. V tomto ohledu je tedy Coconut o jeden či dva kroky napřed.
articles.title: Pattern matching v programovacím jazyku Coconut (2)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Sluka)
articles.description: Dnes se podíváme ne pomocníka pro generování Java a SQL kódu pro nové databázové tabulky, nástroj v terminálu pro sledování ceny akcií, správu dat v MongoDB a nakonec kliknutím zjistíme veřejnou IP adresu.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (26. 6. 2024)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jiří Eischmann)
articles.description: Více než 20 let byly vyhledávače rozcestníkem Internetu a zajišťovaly hlavní zdroj návštěvnosti pro většinu webů. To se pomalu, ale jistě mění. Čím dál víc slyšíme, že vyhledávače už nejsou, co bývaly.
articles.title: Jak dostat lidi na web či blog v době postvyhledávací

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: S technologií pattern matchingu resp. vylepšenou formou strukturální pattern matching jsme se zde již setkali. V jazyku Coconut je strukturální pattern matching všudypřítomným prvkem a je „mocnější“, než v Pythonu.
articles.title: Pattern matching v programovacím jazyku Coconut

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: CSIRT.CZ)
articles.description: Proběhlo největší evropské cvičení v oblasti kyberbezpečnosti, VMware záplatoval dvě kritické chyby, Kaspersky Labs má v USA zákaz, Quishing je na vzestupu a kolem burzy Kraken vyrůstá zajímavá kauza – to jsou jen některé ze zajímavostí uplynulého týdne v oblasti bezpečnosti.
articles.title: Postřehy z bezpečnosti: Proběhlo Cyber Europe 2024, Kaspersky v USA končí

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Google přesune vývoj Chrome OS od linuxového základu k Androidu. Canonical s DeepComputing chystají notebook s RISC-V a Ubuntu. Vyšel postmarketOS 24.06, prostředí Cinnamon 6.2 se stihne dostat do Linux Mintu 22.
articles.title: Chromium OS přechází na Android, RISC-V notebook s Ubuntu

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ovladač GPU Raspberry Pi 5 snad brzy v upstreamu, Mike Blumenkrantz z Valve zase válí, zrychlil Mesa/glReadPixels, ovladač Intel Xe zase blíže i915, dostává podporu Platform Monitoring Technology.
articles.title: Režim černobílé TV v Linuxu 6.11, darktable 4.8 opět bez AI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Ještě další tři roky mohou provozovatelé strojů s CentOS 7 čerpat placenou podporu. Ne však u Red Hatu, ale u SUSE, a to v rámci programu SUSE Liberty Linux. Podpora CentOS 7 tak nakonec dosáhne délky téměř 14 let.
articles.title: Red Hat končí s CentOS 7, jeho další podporu nabízí SUSE, první rok za 50 Kč měsíčně

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Tišnovský)
articles.description: Na článek o „univerzálním“ transpileru py2many dnes navážeme a dokončíme popis možností a schopností tohoto nástroje. Ukážeme si způsob překladu konstrukcí async a await, try a except, použití pattern matchingu i překlad kódů s definicí tříd.
articles.title: Projekt py2many: dokončení

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Filip Zatloukal)
articles.description: Sonda do světa otevřeného softwaru. Dnes si otestujeme sítě, vyzkoušíme aplikaci pro automatické klikání, dáme si dohromady svoje úkoly pomocí Kanbanu a podíváme se na prohlížeč 3D modelů.
articles.title: Softwarová sklizeň (19. 6. 2024): automatické klikání myší pro Wayland i X11

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Na červnovém setkání členů sdružení NIX.CZ představili zástupci vedení českého neutrálního propojovacího uzlu nový ceník. Ten je platný od 1. července tohoto roku a už nyní je k dispozici na webu sdružení. Peeringový uzel opět zlevňuje přípojky, změny se týkají poplatků za porty 10, 25, 100 a 400GE.
articles.title: NIX.CZ snižuje poplatky za přípojky 10, 25, 100 a 400GE

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Kvůli možným útokům na SHA-1, jejichž pravděpodobnost postupem doby a rostoucího výkonu počítačů se jen zvyšuje bylo v rámci Fedory navrženo učinit SHA-1 signatury nedůvěryhodnými. Fedora 41 tak bude prvním vydáním této distribuce, které bude blokovat vytváření a verifikaci SHA-1 signatur, samozřejmě myšleno ve výchozím nastavení.
articles.title: Fedora 41 už nebude u OpenSSL důvěřovat SHA-1 signaturám

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Tvrtko Ursulin z Igalia poslal v úterý do jádra emulaci NUMA (Non-uniform memory access) pro arm64. I když se to zdá neintuitivní, tak zapnutí emulace NUMA a interleave zvýší výkon Raspberry Pi 5 v testu Geekbench o 6 % pro jednovláknové úlohy a  o 18 % pro vícevláknové.
articles.title: Emulace NUMA pro arm64 zvýší výkon Raspberry Pi 5 až o 18 %

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Nejnovější věcí schválenou The Fedora Engineering and Steering Committee je přepracování stávajícího Fedořího instalátoru Anaconda do podoby nativní Wayland aplikace. Jak se pozdržely práce na novém instalátoru postaveném na webových technologiích až k Fedoře 42, která vyjde v příštím roce, bylo navrženo a schváleno, že Anaconda bude přepsána pro Wayland.
articles.title: Instalátor Anaconda pro Fedoru 41 přejde z X11 na Wayland

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Společnost T-Mobile Czech Republic se stala prvním mobilním operátorem v České republice, který začal využívat službu VIP doména poskytovanou sdružením CZ.NIC. Správce české národní domény začal nabízet tuto službu od začátku letošního roku. VIP doména je zaměřena na organizace a společnosti, pro které je klíčová bezpečnost, plná funkčnost a dostupnost jejich digitálních služeb provozovaných na příslušné doméně s koncovkou .CZ.
articles.title: T-Mobile využívá službu VIP doména od sdružení CZ.NIC

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Petr Krčmář)
articles.description: Každé vydání Debianu má jiné grafické téma, které je vidět na spouštěcí obrazovce, přihlašovací obrazovce a především na pracovní ploše desktopového prostředí. Na příští rok se připravuje nová verze Debianu s kódovým jménem Trixie. Jako obvykle jde o postavičku z filmu Příběh hraček, konkrétně ze třetího dílu.
articles.title: Hledá se grafika pro příští vydání Debianu Trixie

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Zajímavý důsledek pro staré notebooky a počítače běžící na integrovaných GPU Intel má implementace tripple-bufferingu v KDE Plasmě 6.1. Hlavní vývojář kompozitoru KDE KWin Xaver Hugl hlásí, že mu chodí zprávy o tom, jak ze sekajících se 30 až 40 fps najednou prostředí běží stabilně při 60 fps. A má k tomu i vysvětlení.
articles.title: Tripple-buffering v KDE Plasma 6.1 dělá ze starých Intel iGPU rychlíky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chcete se stát odborníky na monitoring pomocí systému Zabbix? Nabízíme pětidenní kurz Zabbix, který probíhá online a je zaměřen na řešení praktických problémů. Kurz je dotován Úřadem práce, od kterého můžete získat až 82 % ceny kurzu. Kontaktujte naši kolegyni pavla.hettnerova@iinfo.cz.
articles.title: Pětidenní kurz Zabbix dotovaný Úřadem práce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Vilém Sládek)
articles.description: Pod názvem Den IPv6 2024 se v Národní technické knihovně v pražských Dejvicích konala 6. června akce věnovaná internetovému protokolu IPv6.
articles.title: Prezentace a videa z konference Den IPv6 2024 jsou na webu akce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Pavel Štrobl)
articles.description: Blíží se další Cloud Native Prague meetup, který je již 14. v pořadí. A rozhodně je o co stát, tentokráte se budeme bavit o základech observability a promluví u nás mluvčí z Grafana Labs a Cloud Native Computing Foundation. Takže si meetup rozhodně nenechte ujít.
articles.title: Cloud Native Prague #14: O observability s Grafana Labs

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Zakladatel WikiLeaks je na svobodě. Jullian Assange, který léta strávil schovaný na Ekvádorském velvyslanectví v Londýně, aby nebyl vydán do Švédska či USA a posléze v samotné Británii seděl posledních několik let ve vazbě (více než 1900 dní ve věznici s maximální ostrahou), se dohodl s americkým Ministerstvem spravedlnosti na přiznání viny, za což mu byl vyměřen trest ve výši odpovídající době strávené v britské vazbě.
articles.title: Jullian Assange se dohodl s USA, už je na svobodě

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Qualcomm v dubnu představil nové ARM SoC Snapdragon X Elite (12 jader) a Snapdragon X Plus (10 jader). Jsou primárně určené pro notebooky s Windows (ARM edice), ale pravděpodobně budou fungovat také s Linuxem.
articles.title: Podpora GPU Snapdragon X Elite bude v jádře 6.11

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Před dvěma týdny vývojář v důchodu Martin C. Martin objevil chybu v 55 let staré hře Lunar Lander. Tu vytvořil tenkrát 17letý student střední školy Jim Storer v roce 1969, jen několik měsíců po prvním přistání lidí na Měsíci.
articles.title: Objevena chyba v 55 let staré hře Lunar Lander

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Zajímá vás moderní přístup ke službám a témata jako Docker, kontejnery, cloud, virtualizace a Kubernetes? Připravili jsme pro vás čtyřdenní kurz Docker s Kubernetes, na který můžete získat dotaci až 82 % od Úřadu práce. Kontaktujte naši kolegyni pavla.hettnerova@iinfo.cz.
articles.title: Čtyřdenní kurz Docker s Kubernetes dotovaný Úřadem práce

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Eclypsium objevilo novou kritickou zranitelnost CVE-2024–0762, které dalo přezdívku UEFIcanhazbufferowerflow. Jde o zranitelnost UEFI Phoenix v modulu pro TPM. Pro zranitelnost ale ani nemusí být TPM přítomen. Chyba byla objevena v Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon 7th Gen a X1 Yoga 4th Gen. Nicméně Phoenix později oznámil, že se chyba týká patrně všech jejich UEFI firmware s procesory Intel AlderLake, CoffeeLake, CometLake, IceLake, JasperLake, KabyLake, MeteorLake, RaptorLake, RocketLake a TigerLake. Zranitelné tedy jsou tedy stovky modelů od Lenovo, Dell, Acer a HP.
articles.title: Zranitelnost UEFIcanhazbufferowerflow ohrožuje počítače s procesorem Intel a biosem Phoenix

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Ku příležitosti letních slev na GOG.com je možné zdarma získat RPG hru Shadows: Awakening, která je dílem slovenského studia Games Farm a je součástí fantasy série Heretic Kingdoms.
articles.title: Hra Shadows: Awakening na GOG.com zdarma

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Pokud máte v různých herních obchodech nakoupeny digitální hry za spousty peněz, mohlo by vás zajímat, co se s nimi stane po vaší smrti. Mohou se dědit? Na Steamu máte smůlu. Účet na Steamu patří jenom vám a nejde převést na jinou osobu. Neoficiálně je možné blízkým sdělit heslo, ale je otázka do jaké míry je to legální. Navíc je stále častější použití 2FA.
articles.title: Co se stane s digitálními hrami po vaší smrti?

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Japonský telekomunikační gigant Softbank, který je mimochodem je stále vlastníkem ARM, plánuje pomocí AI měnit hlas naštvaných zákazníků, aby zněl klidněji. Technologii nazývají „emotion canceling“ zřejmě podle vzoru noise canceling.
articles.title: Softbank plánuje měnit hlas naštvaných zákazníků pomocí AI

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Mára)
articles.description: Agentura Reuters upozornila, že Bidenova administrativa tento čtvrtek oznámila plány na zákaz prodeje antivirového softwaru produkovaného ruskou firmou Kaspersky Lab ve Spojených státech.
articles.title: Prodej softwaru firmy Kaspersky bude v USA kvůli vazbám na Rusko zakázán

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Atom)
articles.description: Před pár dny se tu objevila zprávička o "Chat Control", tedy o evropském povinném skenování soukromých zpráv.
articles.title: Legislativa o povinném skenování soukromých zpráv byla vyňata z agendy

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Redakce)
articles.description: Chceš začít s programováním? Python je oblíbený programovací jazyk mezi vývojáři i zaměstnavateli a zároveň super vstupenka do světa programování. Nauč se přemýšlet jako programátor a efektivně využívat Python na řešení nejrůznějších problémů. Online Python Akademie znamená celkem 12 týdnů, vždy jedna lekce týdně, večer od 18:00 do 21:00. Následující kurz začíná 7. srpna.
articles.title: Online Python Akademie: začněte s programováním v oblíbeném jazyce (online kurz)

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Film The Last Screenwriter (Poslední scenárista) režiséra Petera Luisi je patrně prvním filmem, který celý napsala umělá inteligence. Film napsal ChatGPT a pojednává  známém scenáristovi Jackovi, který se setká s AI. Ačkoliv je zpočátku skeptický, později pochopí, že AI rozumí lidským emocím lépe.
articles.title: Zrušena premiéra filmu The Last Screenwriter, který napsal ChatGPT

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: Jan Fikar)
articles.description: Volba CONFIG_FORCE_NR_CPUS v jádře je schovaná za EXPERTS a umožní jádro zkompilovat s přesně známým počtem procesorů. To zjednoduší například vytváření cpumask, který nemusí být dynamický. Celkově pak je jádro s NR_CPUS=4  asi jen o 46 kB menší. Hodí se tedy pro například pro embedded systémy, ale stejně neušetří hodně.
articles.title: Linus Torvalds zruší FORCE_NR_CPUS, způsobuje zmatky

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Dosud používá Fedora pro řízení provozních parametrů počítače démona power-profiles-daemon. S vydáním Fedory 41 však dojde ke změně, kdy tento bude nahrazen slibnějším projektem Tuned. V rámci něho totiž byly vyřešeny překladové API vrstvy mezi Tuned a  power-profiles-daemon.
articles.title: Fedora 41 chystá nahrazení Power-Profiles-Daemon za pokročilejší Tuned

articles.author: redakce@root.cz (Root.cz: David Ježek)
articles.description: Každý, kdo poslední dobou s příslušnou verzí systemd pustil příkaz systemd-tmpfiles --purge pro vymazání dočasných souborů, se nestačil divit, neb mu s nimi zmizely i všechny soubory a adresáře s konfigurační službou tmpfiles.d, tedy včetně kompletního  /home.
articles.title: Nová verze systemd 256.1 upravuje systemd-tmpfiles, už nečekaně nesmaže celý /home

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Red Hat vydal aktualizace Enterprise Linuxu, následovala alternativní sestavení. Podívejme se také na některé specializované linuxové distribuce: PrimTux pro vzdělávání, LibreELEC s novým Kodi, hudební server Daphile, KDE neon a TUXEDO OS s KDE Plasma 6 či Network Security Toolkit.
articles.title: Distribuční novinky 18-19/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přes 70 % společností se zatím nepřipravuje na nový zákon o kybernetické bezpečnosti. Česko je evropskou špičkou v elektronickém sdílení informací, slabší je využívání ERP systémů. Americký výrobce čipů onsemi chce rozšířit za víc než 40 mld. Kč závod v Rožnově. Automatizace sítí pomáhá i jejich bezpečnosti. Sestrojili magnetickou paměť založenou na spirálních magnetech. Firmy vyzvaly Fialu, aby přerušil schvalování zákona o kyberbezpečnosti. S rozvojem AI v Česku pomůže aktualizovaná Národní strategie umělé inteligence.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz:  Americký výrobce čipů onsemi chce rozšířit za víc než 40 mld. Kč závod v Rožnově

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Ucelený přehled článků, zpráviček a diskusí za minulých 7 dní.
articles.title: Událo se v týdnu 25/2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Velké jazykové modely pod lupou: v testu z kognitivní psychologie si vedl nejlépe GPT-4. V CERNu přesně změřili rychlost zvuku v kvark-gluonovém plazmatu. Vědci převádí do obrazů počítačové viry a učí umělou inteligenci je rozpoznat. V Česku vznikne národní centrum pro polovodiče a čipy. Umělá inteligence pomůže spolehlivěji odhalit zubní kazy.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Modely AI se pro nás chovají iracionálně

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Trend DevOps se zadrhl a už nezvyšuje produktivitu. 66 % společností v ČR plně využívá AI nebo to brzy plánuje. Podniky migrují aplikace z virtuálních počítačů na kontejnery Kubernetes. WD představuje novou strukturu způsobu ukládání dat v průběhu pracovního datového cyklu AI. Od 5G k 5.5G. Proč půltá generace?
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Trend DevOps se zadrhl a už nezvyšuje produktivitu

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Přeměnu mezi skyrmiony a antiskyrmiony demonstrovali i při pokojové teplotě. Superhmotné černé díry vznikají jinak, než si astronomové mysleli. 3D tisk z ledu vytváří umělé cévy.
articles.title: Týden na ScienceMag.cz: Časový krystal v polovodiči by mohl pomoci optickým počítačům

articles.author: Reklama
articles.description: Pololetí rozsekává ceny softwarových licencí, a tím poskytuje další uspokojení těm, kteří hledají nové a ideální řešení pro jejich studijní a pracovní stanice. V současné době jsou na obchodním portálu Goodoffer24.com licence pro Windows a Office se slevami až 91 %: jednoduše použijte vhodný kód exkluzivního kupónu (viz následující instrukce, abyste mohli uplatnit extra slevu při dokončování nákupu) a získali domů nejlepší software za nejlepší cenu.
articles.title: Windows 11 za €20, 10 jen za €14: pololetní slevy až 91 % na Goodoffer24

articles.description: Přehled květnových vydání Jaderných novin: stav vydání jádra, citáty týdne a seznam článků týkajících se jádra.
articles.title: Jaderné noviny – přehled za květen 2024

articles.author: Redakce
articles.description: Nové paměťové zařízení otevírá cestu pro výpočty s umělou inteligencí v extrémních podmínkách. Nabídka Dell AI Factory se rozšiřuje. Popularita Česka jako destinace pro digitální obory roste. IBM a Salesforce rozšiřují partnerství na podporu otevřených a důvěryhodných ekosystémů umělé inteligence a dat. Taktik partnerem pro high-end bezpečnost Thales. Cloud, AI a automatizace pro odvětví telekomunikací: Umění možného.
articles.title: Týden na ITBiz: Popularita Česka jako destinace pro digitální obory roste

articles.title: V křemíkovém nebi končí další ostravský superpočítač

articles.author: Ladislav Hagara
articles.description: Jonathan Thomas oznámil vydání nové verze 3.2.0 video editoru OpenShot (Wikipedie). Zdrojové kódy OpenShotu jsou k dispozici na GitHubu. Ke stažení je také balíček ve formátu AppImage. Stačí jej stáhnout, nastavit právo na spouštění a spustit.

articles.description: Byla vydána nová major verze 6.0 neměnné (immutable) distribuce openSUSE Leap Micro určené pro běh kontejneru a virtuálních strojů. S vydáním verze 6.0 byla ukončena podpora  verze 5.4.
articles.title: openSUSE Leap Micro 6.0

articles.description: Byly zveřejněny videozáznamy, dostupné také s prezentacemi přímo z programu, a také fotogalerie z open source komunitní konference DevConf.CZ 2024 konané od 13. do 15. června  v Brně.
articles.title: Videozáznamy, prezentace a fotogalerie z konference DevConf.CZ 2024

articles.description: Seznam dělá každé úterý odstávku svého datacentra a simuluje tak správnost jejich HA řešení. Dnes se ovšem něco pokazilo a má kompletní výpadek. Nejdou webové služby, mapy apod. Kdo by rád věděl něco více o tom, na čem Seznam běží, tak nelze nepřipomenout LinuxDays 2023:  Podvozek Seznamu - od cloudu až po Datacentrum (Michal Toužín, Miroslav Bezdička).
articles.title: Seznam.cz má výpadek

articles.title: Prezentace a videozáznamy z konference Den IPv6 2024

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: AMD compiler engineers have released AOMP 19.0-2 as the newest version of their downstream LLVM/Clang compiler that carries all of their latest work around OpenMP/AOCC GPU device offloading to Radeon and Instinct hardware. With this updated AOMP compiler is now run-time support for zero-copy with CPU-GPU unified shared memory and various other new features for this GPU/accelerator-focused compiler...
articles.title: AMD's AOMP 19.0-2 Compiler Brings Zero-Copy For CPU-GPU Unified Shared Memory

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Last year a new kernel feature merged in Linux 6.6 was multi-grain(ed) timestamps for file-systems as a means of better timestamp handling originally for NFS compared to the existing coarse-grained timestamps with the once per jiffy timestamps being used for invalidating NFS caches. But multi-grain timestamps was reverted just weeks after landing in the mainline kernel due to corner cases like a newer file with a coarse-grained timestamp appearing earlier than another file with a fine-grained timestamp. Due to subtle bugs like that, multi-grain timestamps were dropped before Linux 6.6 was even released while now there is a revised attempt...
articles.title: Multi-Grain Timestamps Revived For Linux File-Systems

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Upcoming Intel Xeon 6 "Granite Rapids" processors will support a new Structural Based Functional Test at Field (SBAF) testing capability to help verify the health of the CPU cores...

articles.title: Free Software Foundation Names Three New Board Members

articles.description: Intel today issued the Compute Runtime 24.22.29735.20 release as their open-source driver providing OpenCL and oneAPI Level Zero capabilities on Windows and Linux systems. This update was joined by an updated Intel Graphics Compiler, IGC 1.0.16900.23...
articles.title: Intel Compute Runtime 24.22.29735.20 Brings Latest OpenCL & Level Zero Support On Linux

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Archinstall 2.8.1 is now available for the newest version of this easy-to-use, command-line driven installer for the Arch Linux operating system...
articles.title: Arch Linux Installer "Archinstall" 2.8.1 Adds Experimental LVM Support

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: System76 developers are still on track for releasing the alpha version of their Rust-written COSMIC desktop in late July...
articles.title: COSMIC Alpha Desktop Release Still Planned For Late July

articles.description: Ubuntu maker Canonical announced "Everything LTS" as a new initiative where for Ubuntu Pro customers they will offer up a twelve year LTS period for any open-source Docker image...
articles.title: Canonical Offers Up 12 Year "Everything LTS" For Docker Images

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Mesa's Rusticl driver as a Rust-based OpenCL driver for GPUs backed by Gallium3D support now works with the Broadcom V3D driver. This V3D support is notable as it's most commonly associated with the Raspberry Pi single board computers...
articles.title: Rust-Written OpenCL Driver Now Works On Raspberry Pi GPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel

articles.title: AMDVLK 2024.Q2.3 Release Brings Few Changes

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Intel's open-source Linux graphics driver developers continue to be quite busy in preparing for the Xe2 next-generation graphics to be found with forthcoming Lunar Lake processors and the Battlemage discrete graphics cards...
articles.title: Intel Vulkan Driver Enables Cooperative Matrix Support For Xe2 GPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: NVIDIA has upstreamed a patch to the GCC 15 compiler for adding the "-mcpu=grace" option to make it easier to target NVIDIA Grace AArch64 CPU cores from this open-source compiler...
articles.title: GCC 15 Adds NVIDIA Grace CPU Support With "-mcpu=grace" Option

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: OpenSUSE has released Leap Micro 6.0 as stable for this community rebranded build of SUSE Linux Enterprise Micro 6.0. Leap Micro continues to be focused on delivering a very reliable and robust experience for containers and virtual machines...
articles.title: openSUSE Leap Micro 6.0 Now Available For Container & VM Needs

articles.author: Michael Larabel

articles.title: Fedora 41 Will Make OpenSSL Distrust SHA1 Signatures By Default

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Engineers at consulting firm Igalia are exploring NUMA emulation for ARM64 (AArch64) due to the potential of "significant" performance uplift as observed on the popular Raspberry Pi 5 single board computer...
articles.title: NUMA Emulation Yields "Significant Performance Uplift" To Raspberry Pi 5

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: With the recently released KDE Plasma 6.1 desktop environment, those still relying on old Intel integrated graphics should have a much more pleasant experience thanks to improvements made to the KWin compositor. For very old Intel integrated graphics, it can effectively be a night and day difference upgrading to the new Plasma 6.1 desktop...
articles.title: KDE Plasma 6.1 Performing Much Better On Older Intel Integrated Graphics

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: When testing Intel's aggressive software Linux optimizations shipped by way of their in-house Clear Linux distribution, I am most often testing it on their high core count Xeon processors with AVX-512... Over the years in dozens of Phoronix articles there have been countless metrics showing off the out-of-the-box performance benefits from leveraging software built for higher x86_64 micro-architecture feature levels, employing compiler-based function multi-versioning, and the other extensive performance tuning carried out by Intel software engineers. But now with the Intel Xeon 6700E "Sierra Forest" series now being available for these all-E-core server processors, I was curious about quantifying the Clear Linux benefits over the likes of Ubuntu Linux. Here are those benchmarks for those curious about the difference.
articles.title: Intel's Linux Software Optimizations Still Pay Off For Xeon 6700E "Sierra Forest" E-Core CPUs

articles.author: Michael Larabel

Additional AMD P-State driver enhancements are now deemed ready and submitted for staging ahead of next month's Linux 6.11 cycle kicking off...

The Fedora Engineering and Steering Committee (FESCo) has now signed off on that work as expected to make the Anaconda OS installer a native Wayland application...
articles.title: Fedora 41 Installer Proceeding To Transition From X11 To Wayland App

articles.title: OpenShot 3.2 Released With Better Performance For This Open-Source Video Editor

articles.description: Related to the work by Mike Blumenkrantz for significantly improving the Mesa glReadPixels performance by more than 100%, the open-source driver developer at Valve has now enabled compute PBO blits within mainline Mesa for the AMD Radeon "RadeonSI" Gallium3D driver...
articles.title: RadeonSI Enables Compute PBO Blits: "Massively Improves Perf In A Number Of Cases"

articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Llamafile has been one of the better new initiatives out of Mozilla in recent years. articles.author: Michael Larabel
articles.description: Back in 2019 after various speculation-based CPU vulnerabilities began coming to light, Amazon engineers proposed process-local memory allocations for hiding KVM secrets. They were striving for an alternative mitigation for vulnerabilities like L1TF by essentially providing some memory regions for kernel allocations out of view/access from other kernel code. Amazon engineers this week laid out a new proposal after five years of ongoing Linux kernel improvements for MM-local memory allocations for dealing with current and future speculation-based cross-process attacks...
articles.title: Amazon Exploring MM-Local Memory Allocations To Help With Current/Future Speculation Attacks

Give Queelign the Iris of Grace


Giving Queelign the Iris of Grace will get you the Fire Knight Queelign Spirit Ash. This will summon the Fire Knight Queelign to help you and will cost 123 Focus Points to use. It's an okay summon, who can …

articles.author: Michael Beckwith
articles.description:
Yesterday, out of nowhere, Capcom casually announced it was remastering the original Dead Rising. While certainly exciting, it did confuse me why Capcom decided to drop this via a random Tweet instead of teasing it during Summer Game Fest. Turns out it was because it's saving the details for its own Capcom Next showcase.


You won't have to wait long for it either since the showcase is scheduled to take place in less than a week on Monday, July 1. It will air at 3 p.m. PT / 6 p.m. ET / 11 p.m. BST via Capcom's official YouTube channel. Don't go in expecting a surplus of brand-new reveals, though, as Capcom has said it'll only run for 25 minutes and be focusing on just three titles.




Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster is obviously the main highlight. The teaser trailer offered a brief glimpse at the overhauled graphics and Frank West's updated design, but Capcom Next should provide some actual gameplay and hopefully a release window. A 2024 launch would be a nice surprise, though I could see it being saved for 2025 instead.


Capcom will also have updates on Kunitsu-Gami: Path of the Goddess, its Japanese folklore themed action-strategy game. It's set to launch in a few weeks on July 19, so it makes sense for Capcom to give this some focus. I'm definitely curious to see how this will end up performing since it's a new IP from the company.


The only other game to get any attention will be Resident Evil 7, which is coming to iPhone, iPad, and Mac the day after the showcase on July 2. Ideally, Capcom won't dedicate too much time to this one since it's a port of a seven-year old game. I doubt anyone will be tuning in specifically for news on this over the Dead Rising remaster, especially considering the recent report on how other Resident Evil mobile ports are performing (spoilers: they're doing badly).

The post First Dead Rising remaster details and more coming in Capcom summer showcase appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: First Dead Rising remaster details and more coming in Capcom summer showcase

As someone who has finished Elden Ring's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, I shall not lie to you, Tarnished. This DLC definitely presents the toughest challenge that FromSoftware has ever given us. articles.description:
Disney Dreamlight Valley offers hundreds of recipes for you to cook, from simple fish dishes to complex pizzas, soups, or desserts. Wonton soup sits comfortably in the middle, requiring four different ingredients. Nonetheless, as long as you can access every biome up to the Forest of Valor, you can make this recipe right now.


Wonton Soup recipe in Disney Dreamlight Valley


Below is the exact recipe for making wonton soup in Disney Dreamlight Valley:



Eggs


Shrimp


Wheat


Onion



Once you have all four items, head to any stove or the Chez Remy kitchen and use them in the cooking pot alongside one piece of coal for every batch you make. Now, you can deliver it to characters like Mushu and the Beast, use it as a favorite gift, or eat it for some extra energy.


Screenshot by Destructoid


You'll initially unlock the wonton soup recipe after progressing through Mushu's level four friendship quest. However, you can make it before this point if you have the ingredients for it. If you don't have the recipe yet, Mushu will give you a book that teaches you how to make it and automatically fills your collection log with the recipe. 


All Wonton Soup ingredients


Some wonton soup ingredients are easier to obtain than others. While wheat is obtainable after unlocking Peaceful Meadows, onions require entering the Forest of Valor. Below is the list of every item and their locations:



Eggs: Chez Remy shop


Wheat: Peaceful Meadows


Shrimp: Dazzle Beach (fishing)


Onion: Forest of Valor



The most challenging item of these four is onions, which take one hour and 15 minutes to grow. Alternatively, if you have WALL-E's garden, you can find onions and wheat among the possible produce options. The higher your garden's level, the more likely you are to find various crops.

The post How to make Wonton Soup in Disney Dreamlight Valley appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to make Wonton Soup in Disney Dreamlight Valley

NBA 2K24 Season 8's release date and main rewards for the upcoming weeks in what could be the penultimate set of content of MyTeam and MyCareer modes.

Season 8 will go live on Friday, June 28. The date will be the same for both PC and console users, and the new content will be available at 8 a.m. PT/11 a.m. ET, marking the release of both free and premium pass.




NBA 2K24 Season 8 MyCareer rewards


The new season will offer plenty of rewards in the MyCareer mode. Most of the rewards are themed around the USA Men's and Women's basketball teams, who will be vying for Gold at the Olympics. Here are all the featured rewards that can be unlocked from the pass.



Level 15 Team USA Outfit

NBA 2K24 Season 8 MyTeam mode


As usual, MyTeam mode players will have plenty of unique cards to unlock and improve their squads. Here are some of the featured rewards that can be obtained from the pass.

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
During Disney Dreamlight Valley's The Mushu Program quest, you and Mushu will encourage the Beast to become more confident. Initially, you and Mushu show him the classic ink blot test before pivoting to destroying old furniture and crafting a mannequin. Before you can make the mannequin, though, you'll need some of the Beast's old clothes.


Beast's old clothes location in Disney Dreamlight Valley


The Beast's old clothes are in his bedroom behind a divider near the bathtub. By searching near the dividers, you'll find a folded pile of clothes that, upon interacting with it, reveals The Beast's old attire. Take these clothes from the storage UI to progress through the Mushu Program quest.


Screenshot by Destructoid


If you're unsure how to get to the Beast's old bedroom, walk forward from the Beauty and the Beast Realm's starting location. Run past the piano and potted plants before ascending the stairs and entering the room before you. Once you enter the room, look left to spot the bathtub, dividers, and clothes pile.


Once you have the Beast's old attire, return to the mainland and interact with a crafting station. You'll now have access to the Beastly Mannequin under the Furniture menu, which you craft using the old clothes, Stitch's beast drawing, and Mushu's mannequin you got from Daisy. 


Screenshot by Destructoid


With these three items on hand, craft the mannequin and place it near the Beast's house like you did with the old furniture from the previous task. Doing this brings you one step closer to completing the Mushu Program quest.

The post How to find the Beast’s old clothes in Disney Dreamlight Valley appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to find the Beast’s old clothes in Disney Dreamlight Valley

articles.author: Shawn Robinson
articles.description:
As Destiny 2 progresses through its various plotlines and pieces of content, some cosmetics become unavailable as new ones enter the fray. This is standard and is especially prominent with all the legacy Titles that are now unobtainable. One such cosmetic is an emblem that some people want due to its clean look and the pretty red it evokes. Here's whether you can still get the Slaycation emblem in Destiny 2.


Is the Slaycation emblem still available in Destiny 2?


As of writing, the Slaycation emblem can not be earned. The emblem was previously available before the launch of The Final Shape, given upon completing the New Territory PvP activity. The emblem is unobtainable now that The Final Shape is out, and the New Territory mode is not part of The Crucible.


As for whether the emblem will return in the future, it is currently unclear though ultimately unlikely. Bungie has neither confirmed nor denied that the Slaycation emblem will return in the future. However, they tend not to bring emblems back that were available in the past barring a few exceptions (like reprised raids from Destiny 1 and their emblems).


On the bright side, there are a lot of emblems in Destiny 2 that are similar. The Classy Order emblem for example is quite similar to Slaycation and can be earned by heading to the Bungie Rewards site and putting in the code YRC-C3D-YNC. This should gift you the emblem, but you may need to check with your Postmaster if your emblem inventory is full.

The post Can you still get the Slaycation emblem in Destiny 2? appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Can you still get the Slaycation emblem in Destiny 2?

articles.author: Moulik Mathur

Apex Legends Double Take Collection Event is now live, bringing Quads to the game as players are queuing up in 4-member squads for the Apex Games. As is tradition, the limited-time event comes with new themed items up for grabs. Collecting all of them will automatically reward players with the new Lifeline Prestige Skin.


What are Prestige Skins in Apex Legends?


Prestige Skins in Apex Legends are some of the rarest items in the game, and they are dynamic in nature. Once you unlock a Prestige Skin, players have to complete a set of objectives by playing with the Legend in order to unlock all the variations of the Prestige Skin. These skins can be obtained during a collection event, by opening an Heirloom Shards Pack, or by spending 150 Heirloom Shards in the in-game Mythic store.


Lifel…
articles.title: Apex Legends Double Take Collection Event: Lifeline Prestige Skin and all 24 items

articles.author: Christian Dawson
articles.description:
Unlocking every Prismatic fragment and facet is the only way to make the most of Destiny 2's new Prismatic subclass. Long gone are the days of Bungie giving players all subclass aspects out of the gate. Now, we need to track down each one across The Pale Heart of the Traveler. Here's where to find Memory: Divise Darkness and how to complete it.


The real treasure was the mountain we had to climb along the way


The first step is to acquire Memory: Darkness Divisive, which is done by collecting five Memory: Vestige Darkness. These are obtained by completing the mini-events associated with the overgrown chests that glow orange. These range from collecting Darkness Columns to rolling a Darkness tumbleweed into a pit.


Once you have five, they'll automatically be converted into Memory: Divisive Darkness. This will then place a search area indicator on your map at the top of the mountain in The Divide. Put on some comfy boots and your favorite murder-mystery podcast, because we've got quite the hike ahead of us.


Image by Destructoid


Spawn in The Blooming and head southeast to The Seclusion. Follow the path through Zavala's hall of tortured memories until you come to the replica of his shack. Keep going straight to the cave in the opposite corner of the area. Continue through the caverns of upside-down trees and waterfalls until you reach the frozen waters of The Divide.


Trek up the frozen escarpment until you reach the area that looks like the entrance to Shadow Moses Island. Look over the ledge on the cliffside and down to spot the chest resting on the walkway below.


Image by Destructoid


The chest contains the Facet of Honor Prismatic Fragment. When equipped as part of the Prismatic subclass kit, you'll gain +10 Strength and Transcendance energy matching the elemental pickup. Destroying a Strand Tangle will also grant Transcendance energy.

The post Where to find Memory: Divisive Darkness in Destiny 2 appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Where to find Memory: Divisive Darkness in Destiny 2

articles.author: Tiago Manuel
articles.description:
Cosplayers Cinderys and CosplayXia just used The Cosmodrome, Bungie's community showcase, to reveal their cosplay of The Witness, one of the most otherworldly-looking characters in the history of Destiny, and it looks so good it could feature on a Destiny movie adaptation right now.


I’ll be the first to admit that I clowned hard on the appearance of Destiny 2's The Witness, a.k.a. The Entity, when Bungie first revealed the villain that would lead the charge in The Final Shape. The weird space unibrow plus the cloud of heads hovering over their own head just seemed too goofy and impractical for an enemy that wanted to seem menacing, for players who'd already been up against half the galaxy. I was very wrong.




The video above shows both the final work and the making of the promotional video showcase. And sure, there are some effects done in post to add the background with the flying pyramids, VFX to make The Witness' weird movements come to live, and even some CG to bring The Witness' cloud of smoke look more realistic. Still, there are a lot of practical effects, high-tech animatronics, and even practical smoke involved. The whole thing works very well even without all the CGI smoke-and-mirrors. The make-up, the shiny Grey Alien-looking eyes, the costume design and fabric all look spectacular.


There's no better way to prove that a character could actually kick ass in real life than having a cosplayer actually embodying it, and Cinderys pulled it off perfectly. From now on, I'll refrain from writing off any idea of a cosplay as "impossible."


You can now face off against the real video game Witness on Destiny 2: The Final Shape on PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, and Xbox Series X|S.




The post Destiny 2 fan shows off incredible Witness cosplay appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Destiny 2 fan shows off incredible Witness cosplay

Some Incantations come to Melinoë as if shared by some greater force. Regardless of how the spells appear, they're all incredibly useful in Melinoë's fight to defeat Chronos and free her family.


All Hades 2 Incantations and Rewards

articles.author: Shawn Robinson
articles.description:
God rolls are the bread and butter of Destiny 2's late game, especially if you're a PvP player. The late game of any MMO like Destiny involves much min-maxing your build, so changing every stat you can along with perks can make a huge difference. One such weapon is quite new but can be farmed as part of a common activity. Here's the god roll for the Scintillation Linear Fusion Rifle in Destiny 2.


The best perks and attachments for the Scintillation linear fusion rifle in Destiny 2


Image via Destructoid.


Scintillation is part of a group of weapons from the Nightfall activity that receive the Origin Trait Veist Stinger. This trait gives shots a 10% chance to activate the Veist Stinger buff for seven seconds, which refills the magazine by 25% from reserves and decreases the movement speed penalty from aiming down sights by 10%. It isn't a huge buff, but it can help you keep sustained DPS a bit longer. The perks and attachments we're choosing here help to further that goal:



Barrel: Corkscrew Rifling


Battery: Enhanced Battery


Perk 1: Envious Assassin


Perk 2: Bait and Switch



Corkscrew Rifling immediately improves range, stability, and handling speed, letting you stay on target much easier. Meanwhile, Enhanced Battery provides an extra shot to increase the returns to the magazine. Envious Assassin also returns shots to the magazine, provided you're killing enemies with your other weapons beforehand. Bait and Switch also buffs you based on your kills with other weapons, but instead improves damage. In essence, you want to get kills with your two other weapons, then swap to Scintillation to do major boss damage. Depending on how much you trust your teammates, Firing Line is another great choice.

The post Destiny 2 Scintillation god roll – Best perks and attachments appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: Destiny 2 Scintillation god roll – Best perks and attachments

articles.author: Madison Benson
articles.description:
Disney Dreamlight Valley's Lucky Dragon update introduced three tea recipes, each with their own unique ingredients and stat values. However, unlocking their ingredients requires building Mulan's tea stall, which you can do shortly after inviting her to your village.


How to make tea in Disney Dreamlight Valley


You'll build Mulan's tea stall and unlock tea-making after advancing through her level two Friendship quest, Daily Regime. During this mission, you'll cook vegetarian pizzas for her before venturing out to mine gems. As a reward for completing these objectives, Mulan will introduce tea to Dreamlight Valley, allowing you to build her tea stall and purchase ingredients for these drinks.


Screenshot by Destructoid


However, you'll have to invite Mulan to Dreamlight Valley before you build her tea stall. You unlock her and Mushu as characters by traveling to Mulan's Realm and helping them improve the area's defences. From here, you can befriend them, leading into Mulan's Daily Regime quest at level two.


After beginning Daily Regime, you'll have the following objectives to complete:



Cook some Vegetarian pizza.


Follow Mulan's training routine by mining topaz, aquamarine, garnet, and peridot.


Enter the Mulan Realm to search for tea crates.



Most of these are straightforward, as Mulan will give you the recipe for the pizza and tea throughout the quest. Mining each mineral is more time-consuming than anything, while the tea crates are within the base camp where you created Mushu's dragon statues.


Once you complete each task and place down the tea stall, you can buy Oolong, Jasmine, and Chrysanthemum tea leaves. Use these with their other ingredients to make the tea, allowing you to progress through the Daily Regime quest and officially unlock all three tea recipes.

The post How to unlock Mulan’s tea stall in Disney Dreamlight Valley appeared first on Destructoid.
articles.title: How to unlock Mulan’s tea stall in Disney Dreamlight Valley

Apex Legends follows a free-to-play live-service model, where each season introduces a new season and collection events that are filled with cosmetic items such as character and weapon skins, emotes, skydive animations, and more. With every new expansion of Final Fantasy XIV, Mentors have a few new hoops to jump through in order to get their Mentor status back. Sometimes the number of commendations needed increases, but one thing never changes.

Thankfully, the changes that Mentors will need to accommodate in Dawntrail aren’t massive, and pretty easily achievable. There are no huge increases to the number of dungeons Battle Mentors need to complete, for example, and the number of collectables that must b…

Capcom has revealed Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster, a remaster of the Xbox 360 game that first launched in 2006. Though the once previously Xbox-exclusive game has since made its way to PlayStation and PC platforms, it remains unclear which platforms this remaster is coming to. And there's no word on when to expect the remaster either. 
Revealed with a short 47-second teaser trailer, Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster looks great, almost more like a remake than a remaster. It's unclear if this is a remaster of the original 2006 game or the HD version of Dead Rising that launched on PlayStation, Xbox, and PC back in 2017. Regardless, we're stoked to head back into a zombie-infested mall with journalist Frank West whenever this remaster launches. 
Check out the Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster teaser trailer for yourself below: 



Are you excited for Dead Rising Deluxe Remaster? Let us know in the comments below!

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Publisher Playtonic Friends (the publishing arm of Yooka-Laylee developer Playtonic) and Blossom Tales developer Castle Pixel have revealed Cattle Country, a simulation game that's Stardew Valley meets the Wild West. If its first trailer,  which was revealed by IGN today, is any indication, farming/townbuilding sim fans will want to keep an eye on the game. 
The reveal trailer gives us a great look at what to expect, which includes ranching, treasure hunting, mining, farming, and, of course, romancing. The game is coming to PC sometime in the future, but there's no release date or window in sight. Cattle Country's Steam listing simply says the release date is "to be announced." 
Check out the Cattle Country reveal trailer for yourself below: 


As you might be able to hear, the Cattle Country reveal trailer is narrated by Red Dead Redemption 2's Arthur Morgan, or rather, Arthur Morgan's voice actor, Roger Clark. 
"Cattle Country straddles the saddle of cozy wholesome gaming and action-adventure," the game's Steam listing reads. "Serving up hours of the slice-of-life you'd expect on the frontier – including mining, fishing, crafting, and farming – along with deep-rooted Wild West quests delivering stories of romance, cattle drives, bandits, and robberies."
Here are some Cattle Country screenshots: 

While waiting to learn more about Cattle Country, read Game Informer's Stardew Valley review, and then read about Stardew Valley developer ConcernedApe's next simulation game, Haunted Chocolatier. 
What do you think of Cattle Country's reveal? Let us know if it's a game you're interested in checking out in the comments below!
articles.title: Cattle Country Reveal Trailer Promises A Sim Game That's Stardew Valley Meets The Wild West

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
The one and only Elden Ring expansion we're getting, Shadow of the Erdtree, launched last week and thousands of Tarnished went to the shadow realm to take on dozens of new enemies, bosses, and more. Now, just a few days later, developer From Software has released a new patch for the game that should make Shadow of the Erdtree a bit easier. 
Now live, Calibration Update 1.12.2 targets the scaling of the attack and damage negation given to players with each Shadow Realm Blessing upgrade. Here's what's changed: 
The attack and damage negation has been increased for the first half of the maximum amount of Blessing enhancements, and the second half will now be more gradual. 
The attack and damage negation granted by the final level of Blessing enhancements has been slightly increased. 


This patch should apply automatically like any other Elden Ring update but if it doesn't – the Calibration Version listed at the bottom right reads "1.12.2" if it has – select "LOGIN" and that will apply the latest version of the game. 
The only other thing this update contains is word from From Software on a confirmed bug where the raytracing settings of Shadow of the Erdtree are automatically enabled (if you've previously loaded save data from previous game versions), which is causing framerate issues for some players. If you're encountering said issues, check to see if you have raytracing on or off in the game's system graphical settings. 
This patch arrives after one that hit the game last week, which added new hairtsyles, inventory features, balance adjustments, and more to Elden Ring ahead of Shadow of the Erdtree's launch. 
For more about the game, read Game Informer's Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree review, and then check out this interview where From Software's Hidetaka Miyazaki discusses his approach to difficulty in games. 
What do you think of this update? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: The Latest Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree Update Should Make Your Journey A Bit Easier

Though you’ll be performing things like light and heavy attacks using the same buttons, what those attacks do varies based on your class. For example, a sword-and-shield Warrior can hip-fire or aim their shield to throw it like Captain America, whereas a Mage can use that…

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Netflix has announced that Thirsty Suitors, last year’s skateboarding cooking RPG, has joined its roster of games. Additionally, a few new titles, such as The Case of the Golden Idol, are available now on the service.
Thirsty Suitors, a story-driven turn-based RPG about a woman battling her various exes (to the chagrin of her disapproving parents), launched last November. The surreal experience also features skateboarding gameplay and cooking mechanics, with the entire package garnering positive reviews upon release. The move to Netflix Games means it will become available to play on mobile devices for Netflix subscribers. There's no date for when Thirsty Suitors arrives on Netflix, but it's "coming soon."


As for new games hitting Netflix this month, acclaimed point-and-click mystery game The Case of the Golden Idol is now available. Joining it is Cozy Grove: Camp Spirit, the Netflix-exclusive sequel to 2021’s Cozy Grove, Hearts, and Netflix Stories: Perfect Match. Subscribers can check out all of these games right now.
Netflix Games has amassed quite the library for itself over the last year or so. Other games to become available on the service include Hades, Grand Theft Auto: The Trilogy, Oxenfree II: Lost Signals, and more.
articles.title: Thirsty Suitors Joins Netflix Games Roster, The Case Of The Golden Idol And More Available Now

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed, the remake of 2010’s Epic Mickey, has a release date. Look for it to arrive on September 24.
The game was first revealed during a Nintendo Partner Direct in February. The remake is being handled by developer Purple Lamp and features reworked gameplay (the original was played with Wii motion controls, after all), new brush abilities for Mickey, and a graphical upgrade. A new trailer features a chat with the game's original creative director Warren Spector, who is also involved with this remake, to reveal Rebrushed's Collector's Edition.
For $199.99, this special box is available for pre-order now and includes the following items:
The full game Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed
A 28 cm Mickey Mouse statue
An Oswald the Lucky Rabbit keychain
A vintage Mickey Mouse tin sign
Six Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed postcards
A Collector’s Steelbook
The Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed costume pack


If you missed the original game, it sees Mickey explore a fantasy world called the Wasteland filled with obscure Disney characters, namely antagonist Oswald the Lucky Rabbit, Disney's original animation star who predates Mickey Mouse. The Wasteland has been taken over by an entity called the Blot, which Mickey accidentally unleashed and must now stop. The 3D action platformer sees Mickey wielding a magic paintbrush that can create new objects while erasing others, and Mickey's actions shape his destiny and the game's story. 
Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed will be available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X/S, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC. You can read our review of the original Epic Mickey here.
articles.title: Disney Epic Mickey: Rebrushed Paints A September Launch Date, Collector's Edition Revealed

Atari 50: The Anniversary Celebration is already a fantastic history lesson and playable compilation of Atari’s heyday, but it’s about to become even more comprehensive. The 2022 interactive documentary is getting an expansion that adds new timelines and 39 games.
This new version of the game is called Atari 50: The Anniversary Celebration Expanded Edition, and it arrives on October 25. It will be released as DLC to Atari 50 owners and as a standalone title, both digitally and physically. Developer Digital Eclipse (which Atari acquired in 2023) is bolstering the compilation with two new timelines.
First is "The Wider World of Atari", which features 19 playable games and eight video segments. Topics discussed include Pong creator Al Alcorn discussing the birth of Breakout, a spotlight on ar…

articles.author: Brian Shea
articles.description:
From Software games have garnered a reputation – alongside the rest of the Soulslike subgenre – for delivering difficult, punishing experiences that reward persistence with an unparalleled thrill of victory. The latest release, Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree, has attracted attention and, in some sectors of the fan base, controversy for how punishingly difficult it is. The week before the expansion's release, we sat down with From Software president Hidetaka Miyazaki to talk about the notion of difficulty and how the passionate fan base has surprised him over the years.
The Soulslike genre, particularly From Software games, puts an emphasis on death as part of the gameplay experience. When you fight a challenging enemy, it may feel insurmountable, but by taking a studious and persistent …
articles.title: From Software's Hidetaka Miyazaki Discusses His Approach To Difficulty

articles.author: Marcus Stewart
articles.description:
Remakes tend to be more exciting than remasters because the improvements often go beyond mere bumps in resolution or framerate. At best, studios reimagine classic experiences in exciting new ways, sand away rough edges, and somehow retain the intangible x-factors that made fans fall in love with these titles in the first place. At the very least, remakes offer a great way to play antiquated or less accessible experiences on modern hardware. 
The remake boom has been in full swing in recent years to the point that it’s starting to get tough to keep track of all the projects in the works. Thankfully, we’ve gathered as many of the announced remakes (not remasters) that we could find and gathered them in one neat list, arranged chronologically by release window. This will be an evolving list t…
articles.title: The Big List Of Upcoming Video Game Remakes

articles.author: Wesley LeBlanc
articles.description:
Developer Mojang has revealed that a native version of Minecraft is finally coming to PlayStation 5. It's currently in a testing phase, but if you own the PlayStation 4 version of the game for your PS5, you can take part in the preview right now. 
Though Minecraft has been playable on PS5 for years, it's always been the PS4 version; this native version, however, is a new build of Minecraft made specifically for PS5, which means it will theoretically perform better on the console. 


"Currently, however, the only way to play Minecraft on a PlayStation 5 is by purchasing the PlayStation 4 version of the game," the announcement reads. "By developing a native version of Minecraft for PS5, we'll be able to make the game run more effectively on the PS5's hardware." 
Though Mojang hasn't revealed how long the Minecraft PS5 version preview will last, all are welcome to take part in it, so long as they own the PS4 version of the game. To access it, go to "Settings" on your PS4 version of Minecraft while playing on a PS5 and select "Preview." This preview includes the new Tricky Trials update, so you can venture into the trial chambers, meet a breeze, craft a mace, and more. 
Mojang asks that players who encounter bugs during this preview report it to the developer, and more generally, provide any feedback they might have. 
For more about the game, read Game Informer's Minecraft review, and then check out this story about how actor Jack Black has all but confirmed he's playing Steve in the upcoming live-action Minecraft movie. After that, read about Netflix's animated Minecraft series. 
Are you excited about a native Minecraft version for PS5? Let us know in the comments below!
articles.title: Minecraft Is Finally Getting A Native PS5 Version

In the meantime, read our thoughts on last year's entry in Game Informer's Madden NFL 24 review.
